title: SERC welcomes new faculty in AI Systems
summary: Dr. Anya Sharma joins our team, bringing expertise in scalable AI infrastructure.
fullContent:
We are thrilled to announce that Dr. Anya Sharma has joined the Supercomputer Education and Research Centre as a new faculty member. Dr. Sharma's research focuses on creating robust and scalable AI infrastructure, a critical area for advancing high-performance computing.

Her expertise will be invaluable to our ongoing projects and will open up new avenues for collaboration and innovation. Before joining IISc, Dr. Sharma was a postdoctoral researcher at Stanford University, where she worked on distributed machine learning systems. Please join us in extending a warm welcome to her.

title: Workshop on Parallel Programming with MPI & OpenMP
summary: A 3-day hands-on workshop for students and researchers.
fullContent:
This intensive three-day workshop will cover the fundamentals and advanced techniques of parallel programming using the Message Passing Interface (MPI) and OpenMP. Participants will engage in hands-on coding sessions, learning how to parallelize scientific applications for high-performance computing clusters.

The workshop is open to all students and researchers with a basic understanding of C++ or Fortran. Registration is required and space is limited.

title: Seminar: Quantum Computing Frontiers
summary: A talk by Prof. Ramesh Gupta from MIT on the future of quantum computation.
fullContent:
Join us for an insightful seminar by the distinguished Prof. Ramesh Gupta from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Prof. Gupta will discuss the latest breakthroughs in quantum computing, the challenges that lie ahead, and the potential impact of this technology on various scientific domains.

The seminar will be followed by a Q&A session. This event is open to the public and will be held in the main SERC auditorium.

title: PARAM Pravega Supercomputer Inaugurated at SERC
summary: Indiaâ€™s latest petascale supercomputer is now operational at SERC, IISc.
fullContent:
The Supercomputer Education and Research Centre (SERC) at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) is proud to announce the inauguration of PARAM Pravega, one of India's most powerful supercomputers.

With a peak performance of 3.3 petaflops, this state-of-the-art system will empower researchers across the nation to tackle complex challenges in fields ranging from climate science and drug discovery to astrophysics and materials science. The system is now fully operational and available to researchers through a national peer-review process.
